page.title: 10Regent's Park: 05280182
page.content: The centrepiece of this block is the main public access to Regent's Park from Marylebone Road and Regent's Park tube station at the S. In summer, crowds stream into the park to enjoy the gardens, lakes and sports facilities. Prominent in the John Nash plan (1811-1828) is the Inner Circle, containing Queen Mary's gardens. Park Crescent leads to Port- land Place and eventually to West- minster, an early piece of town planning. Other attractions are Mme Tussauds and the Planetarium.Education establishments include Bedford College and several music colleges. To the E of the block are many houses and flats including Nash's elegant Chester Terrace. At one time a branch of the Regent's Canal ended here.Now the E of the block contains shops and houses.It is not just a tourist area.
